A trio that formed a decade ago over interests in post-rock and drone (their name means “around” or “widely” in their native Slovenian), they list more than two dozen instruments in the liner notes of their fifth album, from the Persian gheychak to the Mongolian morin khuur. articles.title: Peter Doig: House of Music review – intoxicating paintings with a banging soundtrack
articles.description: Serpentine Gallery, LondonPairing his fantastic landscapes with a soundtrack blasted on vintage sound systems, the painter blurs the lines between club and gallery to seismic effectA giant sound system towers against green mountains in Peter Doig’s painting Maracas, while a tiny man stands on a speaker-stack to reveal the monstrous scale. It’s a utopian – or dystopian – daydream of what sound can be. Could the speakers broadcast enough sonic power, enough soul and love, to blast away reality? They are silent, of course; the mystery, the dread, lies in the expectancy.Not any longer...

articles.author: Andrew Pulver
articles.title: Jennifer Aniston says social media ‘has taken down a huge portion of humanity’
articles.description: The actor condemns ‘runaway train’ of unregulated slander, baseless claims and deepfakes that have dogged her in recent yearsJennifer Aniston has expressed her disdain for social media and its exploitative effects, saying: “It has taken down a huge portion of humanity.”Aniston was speaking to Harper’s Bazaar to coincide with a new season of The Morning Show, the TV series in which she plays a TV presenter opposite Reese Witherspoon. Aniston, who has been the target of media and online gossip for decades, was withering in her criticism, saying: “I’m sure the guys who came up with [...

articles.author: Jason Zinoman
articles.title: Why Arguments About Free Speech Don’t Apply to the Riyadh Comedy Festival
articles.description: Bill Burr, Dave Chappelle and others have framed their participation as a matter of open expression. Yet they’re maddeningly vague about how much dissent is possible in Saudi Arabia.

articles.author: Holland Cotter and Thomas Prior
articles.title: At the Met’s ‘Divine Egypt,’ the Gods are Eternally Fabulous
articles.description: A once-in-a-decade exhibition of ancient deities — many goddesses — ranging over more than 3,000 years, from monumental statues to gleaming figurines.

articles.author: Alyson Krueger
articles.title: Women’s Sports Games Gain Popularity for Bachelorette (and Sometimes Bachelor) Parties
articles.description: Some fans of women’s athletic teams are holding bachelor or bachelorette parties at raucous arenas and stadiums around the world.

articles.title: 5 Classical Music Albums You Can Listen to Right Now
articles.description: Works by Philip Glass and Bohuslav Martinu, as well as performances by Daniil Trifonov and Jonas Kaufmann, are among the highlights.

articles.title: ‘Severance’ Star Jen Tullock Works Through Christian Upbringing in New Play
articles.description: Jen Tullock’s Off Broadway play, “Nothing Can Take You From the Hand of God,” delves into growing up in a Christian family.

articles.title: My Friend Is Rude to My Wife. How Should I Handle It?
articles.description: Our Ask the Therapist columnist, Lori Gottlieb, advises a reader who is fed up with a longtime pal’s two-faced behavior.

articles.author: Seth Kugel
articles.title: They Found a Hidden Camera in Their Airbnb’s Bathroom. Are They Owed a Refund?
articles.description: When a couple alerted Airbnb to a spy cam in an outlet extender, they thought the listing would be yanked and they’d get a full refund. Wrong on both counts.

articles.author: Beatrice Loayza
articles.title: ‘Urchin’ Review: The Vicious Cycle and Recycle of Addiction and Hope
articles.description: Frank Dillane, starring as a recovering addict in London, elevates this character study, Harris Dickinson’s feature directing debut.

articles.author: Martha Schwendener
articles.title: A.I. Meets Ancient Philosophy
articles.description: In Lu Yang’s art, the deliriousness comes from the collision of cutting-edge technology with centuries-old ideas of the highest order.

articles.author: Alissa Wilkinson
articles.title: ‘Tron: Ares’ Review: Who Needs Logic When You Have Neon?
articles.description: The third “Tron” movie continues the saga begun over four decades ago, and now, the programs are in our world.

articles.title: ‘Soul on Fire’ Review: After Near Death, Rebuilding a Life
articles.description: This adaptation of an autobiographical book by John O’Leary manages to be affecting despite its overly sentimental moments.

articles.description: Goran Hugo Olsson’s archival documentary “Israel Palestine on Swedish Television 1958-1989” excerpts three decades of public programs.
